headshotImage.caption: Zaheer Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Zaheer Khan player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Graeme Smith player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled 'em! A tad fuller this time, 133.2ks on a sweet spot, swings in and beats Smith's tame forward drive, ball sneaks through bat and pad and crashes into off stump, big wicket, well bowled Zaheer Khan!

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: GONE! Whoah Nelly! Full, fast and moving away from him, 130.4ks Kallis reaches a long way for it, has a big swish at that and can only nick it through to Tendulkar at first slip! Huge wicket, Zak's back!

headshotImage.caption: Loots Bosman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Loots Bosman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: GONE! Full outside off stump, an impetuous Bosman has a full-blooded drive at that, kitchen sink and all, as they say, and can only get a thick edge to Tendulkar at first slip, who jumps up and pouches a good catch moving to his left, Zaheer gets another

headshotImage.longCaption: Herschelle Gibbs player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! A rank half-volley outside off stump, begging to be hit, Gibbs gets onto bended knee and can only smack that in the air to Kaif at short extra cover, he takes a simple catch and Gibbs has to go, a tame dismissal

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Boucher run out (Pathan/Kumble) 4 (16b 0x4 0x6 36m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: poor running, and thats out! Tossed up, de Villiers gets to the pitch of it and drives in the gap at cover, calls for the second but Boucher is struggling, Pathan covers good ground, swoops in and fires the throw high over Kumble, who jumps, catches it and drops it down onto the stumps and Boucher is out, ever so marginally

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Dhoni b Agarkar 29 (30b 5x4 0x6 47m) SR: 96.66

dismissalComment.html: but Agarkar wins this battle! Shortish outside off stump and de Villiers decides to have a tickle at it and gets a thick edge through to Dhoni, moving to his left, India on a roll!

dismissalText.commentary: Shaun Pollock run out (Dhoni/Kaif) 33 (50b 5x4 0x6 59m) SR: 66

dismissalComment.html: what an effort! Pollock taps the ball towards short cover and takes off for a single but Kemp sends him back. Dhoni moves across quickly and has a shy at the stumps, Kaif moves in behind the stumps from short leg, stretches across - collects the ball and deflects it into the stumps and Pollock is out by a long way - crucial wicket this.

headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Hall player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Rahul Dravid c Hall b Pollock 63 (103b 4x4 1x6 179m) SR: 61.16

dismissalComment.html: banged in short outside off stump, Dravid goes for a hook but doesnt time it and gets a leading edge that balloons up and down to a diving Hall at deep backward square leg, who dives forward and plucks that inches before the ground, South Africa have been excellent with their catching today and Dravid's gritty innings comes to an end

headshotImage.caption: Loots Bosman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Loots Bosman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni c Bosman b Kallis 55 (48b 3x4 4x6 61m) SR: 114.58

dismissalComment.html: pulled and gone courtesy a superb catch! Dropped in short outside off stump, Dhoni's eyes light up and he pulls that hard and flat, looks like another boundary at least but there out of the blue comes Bosman running hard and fast to his left and he dives forward and picks that inches off the ground near the ropes, immense catch to end a fine innings

image.caption: Shaun Pollock profile
image.credit: United Cricket Board of South Africa

headshotImage.caption: Shaun Pollock player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaun Pollock player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Virender Sehwag player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Virender Sehwag player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and gone! short and wide outside the off stump. Sehwag goes for the cut and the ball flies off the top edge, done in by the extra bounce there -  Andrew Hall sprints across in the deep and takes a fine tumbling catch - Pollock strikes in the very first over, Sehwag walks back for a duck.

headshotImage.caption: SR Tendulkar headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SR Tendulkar headshot

dismissalComment.html: Pollock strikes again! short delivery and Tendulkar pulls it straight to Bowman at square leg. The ball was there to be hit but he miserably failed to keep it down.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Kaif player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Kaif player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: and Pollock gets his revenge.  Excellent off-cutter, Kaif goes for the pull, ball clips the inside edge and crashes into the woodwork

headshotImage.caption: Rahul Dravid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahul Dravid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: banged in short outside off stump, Dravid goes for a hook but doesnt time it and gets a leading edge that balloons up and down to a diving Hall at deep backward square leg, who dives forward and plucks that inches before the ground, South Africa have been excellent with their catching today and Dravid's gritty innings comes to an end

headshotImage.caption: Andrew Hall player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Andrew Hall player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Harbhajan Singh player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! Fullish, slower ball outside off stump, and all he can do is roll the wrists and scoop that up in the air towards mid-on where Smith dives to his left and plucks that with his left hand as the ball died on him, end of the road for Harbhajan

headshotImage.caption: Ajit Agarkar player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajit Agarkar player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Full ball on middle and leg. Agarkar loses a bit of balance, falls over and scoops it in the direction of midwicket where Smith times his jump to perfection, stretches his right hand and pulls off another beauty. They're catching them like champions now. The end seems very near

image.caption: Anil Kumble, portrait photo
image.longCaption: Anil Kumble, portrait photo, Melbourne, December 19, 2007

headshotImage.caption: Anil Kumble player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Anil Kumble player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: all over at Newlands! Full-pitched delivery outside off stump, Kumble goes down on one knee and drives, gets an inside edge onto off stump and Hall celebrates with a pumped fist, a spin on the heels, and a happy walk back to the dressing room

dismissalText.commentary: Anil Kumble b Hall 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: all over at Newlands! Full-pitched delivery outside off stump, Kumble goes down on one knee and drives, gets an inside edge onto off stump and Hall celebrates with a pumped fist, a spin on the heels, and a happy walk back to the dressing room

commentPostTextItems.html: So, South Africa wrap this affair up by 106 runs and go 2-0 up with two to play. What a clinical win for them. They were in tatters after Zaheer Khan's good opening burst, but Justin Kemp played out of his skin to slam an unbeaten 100*, his maiden in ODIs, in a fantastic, unbeaten 138-run stand for the eighth wicket with Andrew Hall, who was simply amazing with his 56 not-out. In fact, he was the one who encouraged and inspired Kemp to switch from sedate, stoic caution to in-your-face belligerence. The Indian bowling was, to put it mildly, taken to the dhobi in the slog overs, and a total of 274 was just too much.

India's batting once again came a cropper, with only Rahul Dravid and MS Dhoni getting runs, contrasting in nature thought they were. Shaun Pollock picked up three at the top, and finished with a fine 4 for 26, while Hall backed his batting heroics with 3 for 45. Jacques Kallis picked up two, including Dhoni, and South Africa's fielding was outstanding. India have plenty of soul-searching to do.
Expectedly, Kemp receives the Man-of-the-Match award for his breathtaking innings.

Thats all we have for you today, but do join us again on Wednesday, November  29 for the fourth ODI at Pt Elizabeth. For Cricinfo, this is Jamie Alter signing off, and Sajan Nair sends his thanks for tuning in as well. Cheers!

dismissalText.commentary: Rahul Dravid c Hall b Pollock 63 (103b 4x4 1x6 179m) SR: 61.16

commentPreTextItems.html: We're into the home stretch now. 107 to get from 10.

commentTextItems.html: banged in short outside off stump, Dravid goes for a hook but doesnt time it and gets a leading edge that balloons up and down to a diving Hall at deep backward square leg, who dives forward and plucks that inches before the ground, South Africa have been excellent with their catching today and Dravid's gritty innings comes to an end
full again, tries for the yorker but not accurate enough, and Zaheer checks the shot back to the bowler

milestones.description: Andrew Hall and Justin Kemp's 138-run partnership is the highest for the 8th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 119 between Shane Warne and Paul Reiffel
Andrew Hall and Justin Kemp's 138-run partnership is SA's highest for the 8th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 91 between Klusener and Dale Benkenstein

stories.title: South Africa v India, 2006
stories.subTitle: Third One-Day International
stories.summary: South Africa v India, 2006

stories.title: Fatal flaws at the death
stories.subTitle: India must solve the problem of slog-over bowling
stories.summary: India's bowlers have often been expensive at the slog after making excellent starts to the innings. Their bowlers neither have a good yorker or a slower ball. It is a problem that they have to solve quickly

stories.title: Politicians turn up heat on Chappell
stories.subTitle: Indian coach under fire for remarks on legislators
stories.summary: Greg Chappell, India's coach, has come under fire from Indian politicians after he suggested they were paid to talk and criticize

stories.title: India can still turn things around

stories.title: 'We were outplayed in all departments' - Chappell
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: 'We were outplayed in all departments' - Chappell
stories.summary:
Greg Chappell wasn't a happy man after a game in which India had South
Africa in deep strife at 76 for 6, and yet managed to capitulate to an
106-run defeat.

stories.title: A woeful inattention to details
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.summary:
For much of a beautiful sunny morning at Newlands, this had appeared
India's match to win. But their display over the last 15 overs in the
field was so shockingly poor that they deserved what they got - nothing at
all

stories.title: Smith furious over Nel's exclusion
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.summary:
Graeme Smith, the captain, and Mickey Arthur, the coach, had a big
altercation with Haroon Lorgat, the convener of South Africa's selection
committee, just before the start of the Newlands game on Sunday.

stories.title: Kemp makes its easy for South Africa
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.summary: An astounding display of power hitting from Justin Kemp lit up Cape Town and utterly transformed what seemed like a disastrous day for South Africa into a glorious one as they thumped India by 106 runs to take a 2-0 lead in the series.

stories.title: 'There's absolutely no issue between us' - Dravid
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: 'There's absolutely no issue between us' - Dravid
stories.summary: India's defeat in Durban triggered off the sort of hysterical over-reaction that has become a sad accompaniment to the country's cricket, but Rahul Dravid  was philosophical when asked about the viciousness of some of the criticism

stories.title: 'We won't allow the Indians any chance to get in' - Smith
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: 'We won't allow the Indians any chance to get in' - Smith
stories.summary:
Despite the comprehensive nature of the 157-run victory in Durban, Graeme
Smith asserted that there would be no hint of complacency as they took on
India at Newlands

stories.title: 'This tour is a great opportunity for the young players'
stories.subTitle: South Africa v India, 3rd ODI, Cape Town
stories.seoTitle: 'This tour is a great opportunity for the young players' - Dravid
stories.summary:
Rahul Dravid laughed off suggestions of a tiff with Greg Chappell in
Durban, and emphasised that his team were trying their very best to get
back on track ahead of the Cape Town ODI on Sunday.

stories.title: Fatal flaws at the death
stories.subTitle: India must solve the problem of slog-over bowling
stories.summary: India's bowlers have often been expensive at the slog after making excellent starts to the innings. Their bowlers neither have a good yorker or a slower ball. It is a problem that they have to solve quickly
